evidence.text: The City, its officials, agents, employees, and successors, and all persons acting on behalf of or in active concert or participation with it, shall comply with 42 U.S.C. § 2000e-2(k) when utilizing a written exam as part of its selection process for entry-level Firefighters.

extracted.value: Comply with 42 U.S.C. § 2000e-2(k) when utilizing a written exam as part of its selection process for entry-level Firefighters

evidence.text: The City, its officials, agents, employees, and successors, and all persons acting on behalf of or in active concert or participation with it, are specifically enjoined from using the Challenged Written Exam.

extracted.value: Enjoined from using the Challenged Written Exam

evidence.text: During the term of this Decree, the City shall not administer any written exam for use in selecting entry-level Firefighters without the assent of the United States or, if the Parties cannot reach agreement, approval by the Court pursuant to Paragraph 135.

extracted.value: Cannot administer any written exam for entry-level Firefighters without U.S. assent or court approval

evidence.text: The City will adopt and use a Title VII compliant New Selection Device in place of the Challenged Written Exam to hire entry-level Firefighters.

extracted.value: Adopt and use a Title VII compliant New Selection Device in place of the Challenged Written Exam

evidence.text: No later than thirty (30) days after the Date of Entry of this Decree, the City shall deposit the sum of nine hundred and eighty thousand dollars ($980,000.00) into an interest-bearing account in a federally insured financial institution.
